definition[0]: to add more coal or wood to a fire
example[0]: We kept the fire stoked up high on cold nights.
definition[1]: if something stokes up fear, anger etc, it makes a lot of people feel frightened etc
example[1]: The leaflets stoked up fears of an invasion.
definition[2]: to eat a lot of food, for example because you will not eat again for a long time
example[2]: We stoked up on hot soup before going out in the snow.
